title: Data needed to determine molar enthalpy of soln

content.description: Assume that the <math alttext="K C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> has the same specific heat capacity as pure water and that the initial temperatures of the <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>KCl</mtext> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and the water are the same.
content.question: Which of the following is a list of the minimum amount of data needed for determining the molar enthalpy of solution of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in pure <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mtext>(</mtext> <mrow> <mi>l</mi> </mrow> <mtext>)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ?

choices.label: Mass of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, initial temperature of the water, and final temperature of the solution

Mass of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, initial temperature of the water, and final temperature of the solution

Mass of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, mass of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, initial temperature of the water, and final temperature of the solution

Mass of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, mass of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, initial temperature of the water, final temperature of the solution, and atmospheric pressure

content.answer: Mass of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, mass of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, initial temperature of the water, and final temperature of the solution

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
